org.logicmill.util.concurrent

Class IllegalOffsetValueException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • org.logicmill.util.concurrent.SegmentIntegrityException
          • org.logicmill.util.concurrent.IllegalOffsetValueException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class IllegalOffsetValueException
extends SegmentIntegrityException
    Thrown by ConcurrentHashMapAuditor.verifyMapIntegrity(boolean, int) to indicate that an illegal value was observed in the ConcurrentHashMap.Segment.offsets array. Legal offset values include only NULL_OFFSET (-1) and integers between 0 (inclusive) and HOP_RANGE (32, exclusive). All other values are illegal.
    Author:
    David Curtis
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • IllegalOffsetValueException

        public IllegalOffsetValueException(ConcurrentHashMapProbe.SegmentProbe segmentProbe,
                           int bucketIndex,
                           int offset,
                           int offsetValue)
        Creates and IllegalOffsetValueException with the specified details.
        Parameters:
        segmentProbe - proxy for segment in which exception occurred; uses reflection to access private segment internals
        bucketIndex - index of the bucket in which the illegal offset was observed
        offset - offset (from the bucket index) of the illegal offset value
        offsetValue - the illegal offset value
